DataManipulation

Class MountieQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • DataManipulation.MountieQueries

  • public class MountieQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles most of the queries with the data base.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MountieQueries()
      Default Constructor with no-arguments.
      MountieQueries(java.lang.String sql)
      Constructor with one argument; used mostly for SELECT * queries.
      MountieQueries(java.lang.String sql, java.lang.String searchString)
      Constructor with SQL argument and a search argument; used to find specific records.
      MountieQueries(java.lang.String sql, java.lang.String search1, java.lang.String search2)
      Constructor with arguments; used to search a record that matched 2 parameter.

        search1 - The first specific record attribute to be search for.
        search2 - The second specific record attribute to be search for.

      • addEntry

        public int addEntry(java.lang.String fName_isbn,
                    java.lang.String lName_title,
                    java.lang.String address_pubYear,
                    java.lang.String phone_copies,
                    java.lang.String email_author)
        Add an entry to the data base with the specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        fName_isbn - the students first name or books isbn of new entry.
        lName_title - the students last name or books title of the book.
        address_pubYear - the students address or the books publication year.
        phone_copies - the students phone number or books number of copies.
        email_author - the students email or books author of the book.
        Returns:
        an integer specifying if the query executed successfully.

      • addCheckOut

        public int addCheckOut(int transID,
                       long isbn,
                       int cardID,
                       java.lang.String dateIssue,
                       java.lang.String dateDue)
        Adds a check-out transaction to the data base.
        Parameters:
        transID - the transaction id number.
        isbn - the books isbn number.
        cardID - the student id number.
        dateIssue - the date the book was check-out.
        dateDue - the date the book is due.
        Returns:
        an integer specifying if the query executed successfully.

      • addCheckIn

        public int addCheckIn(long isbn,
                      java.lang.String returnDate)
        Process the books check-in process.
        Parameters:
        isbn - the books isbn number.
        returnDate - the day the book was returned.
        Returns:
        an integer specifying if the query executed successfully.
